result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Bloedow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dated 9/30/15 from Atty Bryce Schoenborn to Drug Court coordinator.  Filed in all cases as no court case number applied to letter.

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Emily Maeve Long.  Defendant Jason A Bloedow in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 13CF136, 14CF7 14CF93,14CF94, 14CF95.  State believes 14CF93 should have been read in for PSI.  Atty Long addresses the court as to sentencing.  DE makes a statement to the court.  
13CF134-Sentence Imposed/Stayed 5 yrs, 3in/2out-has credit for 46 days, concurrent to all cases

13CF136-withhold sentence 2 yrs probation-1 day credit, concurrent to all cases

14CF7-Ct 1-withhold sentence,  2 yrs probation,
            Ct 3-withhold sentence/2 yrs prob-10 days jail, 12 month revocation of DL, $1379.00 fine, Restitution of $22.90, AODA assessment, retro suspension (credit for 13 days) all concurrent

14CF93-$100.00 restitution J/S with Lisa Sutten

14CF94-Ct 1-withhold sentence/5 yrs probation, $100.00 restitution
              Ct 2-withhold sentence/2 yrs probation, all concurrent

14CF95-Ct 1, withhold sentence/2 yrs probation
              Ct 5, withhold sentence/2 yrs probation
              Ct 6-withhold sentence/2 yrs probation
              Ct 7-withhold sentence/2 yrs probation, all concurrent  

Chippewa County case 13CF115 will be dismissed/read in

DE will attend and complete Rusk County Drug Court, pay CC on all counts and restitution as requested, will provide a DNA sample
Phones confiscated may be return to DE
Has credit of 185 days in cases 14CF93, 14CF94, 14CF95.

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Emily Maeve Long.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 13CF136, 14CF7, 14CF93, 14CF94, 14CF95.  DE has entered plea's in 13CF134, 13CF136.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court will order a PSI be prepared.  
13CF134-entered plea previous
13CF136-entered plea previous
14CF7-PLEA OF NC TO CT'S 1,3.  CT'S 2,4 DISMISS/READ IN.
14CF93-DISMISS/READ IN
14CF94-NC PLEA TO CT'S 1 AND 2, DISMISS CTS 3,4,5.
14CF95-NC TO CT'S 1,5,6,7.  DISMISS CT'S 2,3,4,8,9

COURT WILL ACCEPT PLEAS AND FIND THE DE GUILTY.  STAY SENTENCING FOR UPDATE OF PSI.  

CHIPPEWA COUNTY CASE 13CF515-DISMISS/READ IN
 PAY RESTITUTION OF $100.00 IN 13CF134. J/S WITH DOUGLAS CARTER
PAY RESTITUTION OF $22.90 IN 14CF7
PAY RESTITUTION OF $100.00 IN 14CF94, J/S WITH LISA SUTTEN.  
Attorney Long requests that two cells phones in possession be returned or if not returned, not be destroyed.
Will set for sentencing after completion of PSI.
Plea hearing on January 26, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason A Bloedow in court with attorney Emily Maeve Long appearing telephonic.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 13CF136, 14CF7, 14CF93, 14CF94, 14CF95.    Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint in 14CF93, 14CF94, 14CF95-DE will also waive prelim hearing.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing.  Court is satisfied will accept waiver.  Court has reviewed the CC's, will find probable cause exists and bind over.  Atty Long would like to address motoin to revoke bond at at later date.  State will file information and then set for arraignment.  Bond will be concurrent in 14CF93, 14CF94, 14CF95.

Andrea Nodolf appears for the State of WI, DE appears in person in custody with Atty Emily Long appearing telephonic.  $10,000.00 cash bond has been ordered on this case from a riverside hearing.  Atty Long proposes to the court that previous cash bonds posted be refunded to the poster, and a new cash bond of $17,500.00 be issued.  The court will not modify the bonds as requested at this time.  Set for INIT APP 10-16 @ 9:00AM.
